definition[0]: to stop something from happening, or stop someone from doing something
example[0]: The rules are intended to prevent accidents.
example[1]: His back injury may prevent him from playing in tomorrow’s game.
example[2]: We were prevented from entering the site.
example[3]: Wrap small ornaments in paper to prevent them being damaged.
explanation[0]: In everyday English, people usually say stop somebody/something (from) doing something rather than prevent somebody/something (from) doing something:
example[4]: This barrier is to stop people from coming in without a ticket.
definition[1]: to stop something happening, or someone doing something
example[5]: government regulators working to prevent fraud
example[6]: The region’s huge economic problems will prevent it from realizing its potential.
